result.execSummary:
The defendant Bjorn Adive Green was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Cover Letter - Amendment to Judgment

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release Date.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.
April 11, 2016--Plea/Sentencing

Defendant Bjorn Adive Green in court with attorney Lane Fitzgerald.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Count 1 Dismissed and Read In to bar further prosecution; Deft pleads Guilty to Counts 2; Court accepts plea and finds Deft Guilty; PSI WAIVED; Court orders: 5 years bifurcated sentence: 2 years WSPrison, 3 years Extended Supervision; Costs $518, Bond to apply, $18 from bond on 15CM2049; Deft IS ELIGIBLE for Challenge Incarceration Program and Earned Release Program; 32 days credit.
Defendant Bjorn Adive Green in court with attorney Lane Fitzgerald.  David Jon O'Leary appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter continued for trial.

Judge R. Alan Bates presiding.  Attorney Barbara Lynn Gerber and witness Veeko Virola appear in court via video conference; defendant Bjorn Adive Green not in court.  Richard Jay Sullivan and Daniel Niedfeldt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Witness avoiding service, warrant issued, reviewable by Judge Wener only.

Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Witness notified of trial date; Court orders witness held in secure detention until subpoena served.
